Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: The average time taken to fill a job vacancy.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: Total Time from Job Requisition to Job Offer Acceptance / Number of Positions Filled

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: The average cost incurred to hire a new employee.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: Total Recruitment Costs / Number of Hires

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: Measures the effectiveness of the hiring process in selecting high-performing employees.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: (Performance Rating of New Hires / Total Performance Ratings) / Number of New Hires

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: The percentage of job offers accepted by candidates.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: (Number of Accepted Offers / Number of Job Offers Made) * 100

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: The distribution of where new hires come from.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: Percentage of Hires from Different Recruitment Sources (e.g., Job Boards, Referrals, Social Media)

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: Measures the efficiency of moving candidates through the recruitment process.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: (Number of Candidates Moving to Next Stage / Number of Candidates at Previous Stage) * 100

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: Measures how candidates perceive the hiring process.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: (Sum of Candidate Feedback Ratings / Number of Candidates)

Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.EXPLANATION: The percentage of employees who remain with the company over a period.
Corporate+Human Resources+Recruitment an.FORMULA: (Number of Employees Remaining / Total Number of Employees at Start) * 100
